nodes.label: Draw reversible and irreversible changes (ice melting vs. egg cooking)
Blue ice cube labeled 'ice' transitioning into a puddle of water labeled 'water'
Brown and white whole egg labeled 'egg', transitioning into a cracked egg with yellow yolk in a pan labeled 'cooked egg'
Arrows showing reversible ice to water transition
Arrows showing egg cooking as irreversible change
Handwritten text explaining reversibility of ice melting
Partial understanding of why egg cooking is irreversible
Clarify that while ice can refreeze, cooking alters egg's structure permanently
